results.title: Tread softly
results.creator_credit: Rolf De Heer, Di Drew and AFTRS
results.brief_description:
Claire (Robyn Nevin) and Angela (Natalie Bate) have only been been living together for a short time but Claire’s constant attention has already become suffocating to Angela. She needs space and time to be alone.
The painful final stages of an affair that is over but not yet finished.

results.title: Kindred
results.brief_description:
A drama about incest based on a number of case studies. Penny tries to make her mother and younger sister face the reality of her situation as a victim of parental incest.
Written by Debra Oswald and starring Alyson Best and Russell Newman.

results.title: The Girl who met Simone de Beauvoir in Paris
results.creator_credit: Richard Brennan, Richard Wherrett and AFTRS
results.brief_description: Regarded as one of Australia’s acclaimed theatre and artistic directors, Richard Wherrett has transformed his directing skills into film with this adaptation of “The Girl who met Simone de Beauvoir in Paris. Cast includes Tony Llewellyn-Jones, Judy Morris, Anna Volska and John Clayton. Director of Photography, Geoff Burton.

results.title: Gary's story
results.creator_credit: Rolf De Heer, Richard Michalak and AFTRS
results.brief_description:
Gary is between girlfriends. When he meets Sally in the supermarket he discovers that she is between boyfriends so he asks her out.
“What about a cup of coffee?”
“I don’t drink coffee.”
“Tea, then?”
“I don’t believe in stimulants.”
“Milk?”
“Creates mucus.”
From this high point their relationship deteriorates. But Gary’s story has a happy ending – eventually.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Rolf De Heer, Richard Michalak and AFTRS

results.title: Freely given
results.brief_description: “This instrument may be freely given, never bought or sold” says violin maker John Godschall Johnson as we see him carving and shaping a beautifully handcrafted violin into its final form.

group_works.title: Bullet proof and blind
group_works.creator_credit: Paul Healy, Alexandra Long, Ruth Kleinhenz and AFTRS

results.title: The Drip
results.brief_description: No matter what the doting Helmut does, his wife Gertrude is never satisfied. But things are about to change. When an ever-increasing drip starts falling from the sky onto Gertrude’s head, it’s Helmut to the rescue!

results.title: The Cellist
results.brief_description: On the plane, returning to Australia from England, Guy meets Les who is on his way home from a Grand Prix motor race. Guy tells Les he is a cellist with the London Philharmonic Orchestra…but Guy is not all he seems. Cast features John Clayton and Rhys McConnochie and a cameo appearance by James Morrison. Winner of the AFI awards for best short fiction film and best director in 1985. Original format 16 mm
